programme.title: Ask The Doctor
programme.desc: Sandro submits to a humiliating stress test, Caroline discovers how school students can manage their moods, and Shalin explores the science of comfort food.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a body is found surrounded by ritual symbols on the eve of a Psychic Fayre, Barnaby must step into the spiritual world to find the killer. (Final)

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Natalie and Stuart promise to save the soul of their "fixer-upper", but face obstacles with eccentric renovations that risk upsetting the old owners.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: News from where we live. ABC News NSW brings you the days top stories, exclusive investigations and original reporting on the issues that matter to you. Presented by Jeremy Fernandez, plus weather with Tom Saunders.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: When a charismatic sports teacher arrived at Sarah Kopps school, the talented students life was upended. When she finally sought justice, she faced a near-impossible choice.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: Australias leading forum for media analysis and comment. Host Linton Besser, a four-time Walkley award-winning investigative reporter and former foreign correspondent, brings you a fearless critique of the weeks journalism.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the story with the latest on the days events, explaining whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe uncovering what you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Bricklayer Paul Rimmer has spent over forty years restoring and renovating the dilapidated Victorian terraces of Bolton. Now he wants to hand-build a state-of-the-art contemporary home - not out of brick, but out of wood.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Jane tours a stunning country garden, Jerry curbs useful but vigorous plants, Clarence showcases potted features, Guest Presenter Jac combines plant colours and forms, and we meet a photographic artist who loves native flora.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Chas and John cover a monumental week in global affairs as world leaders descend on New York for the UN General Assembly, with Palestinian statehood and wars in Gaza and Ukraine high on the agenda.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: A homeowner takes a tiny rundown heritage-listed workers cottage in the middle of the dense inner city Sydney suburb of Newtown and transforms it into a beautiful, fully sustainable off-grid home. (Final)

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Trying to get their hands on Tom Gleesons Big Brass Mug are experts in Australian zoos, rap group Salt-N-Pepa, animated series BoJack Horseman, and a fascinator-wearing fan of ballet superstar Anna Pavlova.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent
programme.desc: For Gazas one million children growing up isnt guaranteed. For almost two years more than 18,000 kids have been killed as Israel wages war to destroy Hamas. An intimate look at the toll the war is taking on Gazas littlest.

programme.title: Freddie Mercury: The Final Act
programme.desc: The extraordinary story of Freddie Mercurys battle with AIDS and the ground-breaking tribute concert Queen staged in his memory after he died.

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: A strange sound, unexplained symptoms, leaving US diplomats, intelligence and national security officers sick and disoriented. Victims and doctors reveal the toll of Havana Syndrome and their push for care and accountability.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Britains strongest woman, Andrea Thompson, joins the doctors in the lab as they reveal how muscle fibres work, and we say hello to 3 more incredible Ouch Award finalists.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Chloe, a child prodigy Chloe finds it difficult to connect with her much older classmates. The Bears take her under their wing, showing her how to make great college friends.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: A student named Marc gets akumatized into Reverser. Convinced that Marinette and Nathaniel made a fool of him, hes determined to get revenge. Will Ladybug and Cat Noir manage to reverse the situation?

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Vanishing Koalas
programme.desc: Kakow Koalas are the latest snack sensation sweeping the playground and Mario is hungry for justice when his are stolen.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer has a terrible toothache, so Shaun turns dentist in an attempt to cure his woes.

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guides everyday adventurers hoping to make it to the Crystal Dome. Will a team comprised of people paid to play computer games for a living be able to nerd their way to victory?

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Gotta Go Fast, The Sonic Special!
programme.desc: Gems joined by Sonic expert Bajo for a super speedy Sonic episode! Plus, SG sings about Sonics greatest superpower, another date goes astray in Finding Player 2 and Gem and Harry get a surprise in The New Coach!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Newsflash just in... a super gross stink has been detected coming from the vicinity of the Doctors lab. The hunt is on for grossest thing on Operation Ouch!...ever!

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: When a beautiful dress arrives at Malory Towers, the girls are buzzing to realise there is a debutante in their midst, but who is it?

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: You know that one annoying friend who just cant get the hint? Thats Charlie, and hes Bigfoot. The Bears meet Charlie when he signs up on a home-sharing website to spend a weekend with the Bears.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Alyas big sister Nora gets akumatized into Anansi. Now a giant spider woman, she wants to show Alya how dangerous Paris can be. Ladybug and Cat Noir cant be flyweights if they want to stop her!

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Extremely Empty Freezer
programme.desc: Ava plans a birthday party to cheer up a lovesick Mr Barker, but things go wrong when his birthday cake goes missing during the celebrations.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: An unfriendly camper sets up his tent in the sheeps field. When he goes off exploring, Shaun and the Flock decide to do some exploring of their own.

programme.title: Expedition With Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve head to the Djangart mountains of Kyrgyzstan in search of snow leopards. These rugged peaks are almost impenetrable, but if they can find evidence of snow leopards here, they hope to protect this remote range.

programme.title: Louis Therouxs LA Stories
programme.desc: Louis Theroux lifts the lid on the underbelly of Los Angeles. This time Louis examines how California deals with sex offenders after they are released from prison. (Final)

programme.title: Silverpoint
programme.desc: Having made it to the facility and discovered even more about the mysterious Artefact, a reunited Dragonfly seek out the truth of what lies behind the red door.Â Â Â

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Is the Baltic Sea Anomaly really a UFO that crashed into the ocean 600 years ago? Ant thinks it is. But what the Nektons find inside is even more strange and frightening.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Suspect Sprinkler
programme.desc: When the timer on Mrs Maniacis sprinkler system is tampered with before the Garden of the Year; competition, the Inbestigators must track down the culprit.

programme.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic
programme.desc: With their cutie marks finally acquired, the Cutie Mark Crusaders struggle with the question of what to do now. Apple Bloom suggests they embrace their destinies, but she and her friends dont exactly agree on how.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: There are so many clubs for Numberblocks to belong to - its time for Twenty-Nine to figure out where he belongs! Learn about grouping numbers by numerical properties with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Clarence and the kids explore a tropical fruit farm and learn about how they grow, how to pick them and then feast on fruits theyve never tried before.

programme.title: Bitesize Daily
programme.desc: Halves and quarters, counting in halves and quarters, doubling numbers, halving numbers.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Its an undercover operation of the Welsh-valley variety for Agent Spencer as he finds himself in Llanharan, Pontyclun, with a house for sale thats in need of a re-vamp.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: The Mythbusters hook into the decidedly fishy tale of a Killer Carp-tastrophe; can a leaping two-pound fish land a killer blow on a hapless water skier?

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Having been turned away from Janeys door when they try to visit her at university, Ben and Susan book into a hotel under assumed names. But it soon becomes apparent that this is not the only false assumption being made.

programme.title: Heartbreak High
programme.desc: Trying to prove a point to Jodie, Matt works overtime on a science project that could end up having ramifications that reach far beyond Hartley High.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Mermaids dont exist - right? Well, if thats true, then whats that mermaid-shaped thing swimming outside the Aronnax? Ant is determined to find out, even when pirates get in his way.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Peculiar Pop Quiz
programme.desc: Maudie and Ava infiltrate Mr Barkers grade six class to watch his famous pop quiz, where Maudie uncovers a crime.

programme.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic
programme.desc: Spike is forced to compete in a dangerous Gauntlet for the title of Dragon Lord in order to save his friends.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Threes attempts to hide in the Clubhouse get increasingly tricky in a slapstick comedy of Threes! Learn which numbers are multiples of three, with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah and the kids are inspired by a mural in a community garden by a local French artist, Hugues Sineux. They paint pots and add plants to complement the artwork and make the green space even more beautiful.

programme.title: Know It Alls: Science
programme.desc: Brain power will be tested for comedian Lauren Bonner and young Thomas as they use their physiology to decipher the intricate world of Biology to prepare for the nail-biting Quiz.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phils Secret Agent mission takes him to the affluent area of Pinner in Harrow and the five-bed family home of Vaseem, Ayeesha and their two children.

programme.title: George Clarkes Old House New Home
programme.desc: George looks to Japan to help Rachel and Sarah with the ground floor of their Victorian terraced home in Worthing. In Worcestershire, he meets a couple who have bitten off more than they can chew with a 17th century cottage.

programme.title: Austin
programme.desc: Julians documentary capturing his growing relationship with Austin is now out in the open and Julian engages an award-winning filmmaker to finish the job. Is bringing Austin to London the perfect treat for him or for Julian?

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.sub-title: Upsy Daisy Dances With Pinky Ponk
programme.desc: Upsy Daisy shows her love for everything in the garden by dancing.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector discovers a bee in the garden. But how will he get it flying again?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing finds a frog in the garden and wants to keep it so he and Sula make the frog a house in a bucket. But froggy doesnt like her new home and hops out.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Theres a new pupil, Emily Elephant. Everyone wants to be her friend because shes good at building blocks and makes a very loud noise with her trunk. Peppa and Emily have something in common: they both like muddy puddles.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Its breakfast time and the Farmer discovers he has no fresh milk for his morning cup of tea. He sets off in great haste but Shaun and the Flock are too impatient to wait for breakfast and take matters into their own hands.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: As Norman leaves the house, the giant hat he made for the Pontypandy Hat Parade gets stuck in the door, just as the sitting room goes up in flames!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Snooty King and Queen Marigold are coming to visit, but when the Kings new clothes get dirty Nanny cleans them and accidentally shrinks them all.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: At Playgroup, Madame Gazelle talks to the children about hobbies. The children share what they and their parents like to do for fun but everyone knows Peppas hobby is jumping in muddy puddles!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemmas obsession with a pair of passing whales distracts her from her duties. Meanwhile, one of the whales does some wombat watching and becomes beached.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Lobo and Spike learn the power of teamwork and embracing uniqueness in magical adventures filled with lessons on friendship and overcoming challenges.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stanley, Sophie and Benjamin make a Dino-Pirate float for the carnival.

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie goes to the cinema with Akil and Nina, learning to enjoy himself even when it gets a little noisy.

programme.title: Play School Story Time
programme.sub-title: Hamish Blake: Where Is The Green Sheep?
programme.desc: Have you seen the green sheep? Join the search as Hamish Blake and Play Schools Scrap read Where Is The Green Sheep, by Mem Fox and illustrated by Judy Horacek, meeting all sorts of sheep along the way!

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Its snowing! The Alphablocks whip up a wondrous winter wonderland, but can they get Mr Snowman to the North Pole in time? This episode has fun with the words man, fun, sun, fan, tan, van and men.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its snowing and Grampy Rabbit has built a jetpack. He shoots off into the distance ending up on top of a snowy mountain. Miss Rabbit goes to rescue him, but Grampy Rabbit is the one that rescues them all.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: When a young Cornasaurolophus strays from its herd and befriends Ginger and the Peas, all is fine until it starts popping which draws attention of the Bananaraptors!

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: When Tidbit gets a mosquito bite on picture day, he doesnt want a photo... until Vida has an idea!

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Fifi asks Stanley to help her find a new place for her friend Isabelle the Sun-bell Daisy. This proves trickier than initially planned as Isabelle has some specific needs.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Gekko is forced to be a sneaky crocodile instead of a loyal lizard because Pharaoh Boy has taken his friends prisoner.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemmas obsession with a pair of passing whales distracts her from her duties. Meanwhile, one of the whales does some wombat watching and becomes beached.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Bulgy thinks that people should travel by bus instead of rail until he learns that having so many passengers is not so easy for the buses on their own.

programme.title: Reef School
programme.desc: When Oli the octopus discovers the coral is turning white, Chips the pufferfishs Nan tells the Reefies a special story about the beautiful colours of the reef back in the olden days.

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Caterina, John and Captain take turns trying to cheer up Tsehay as she is feeling a little sad today. Sing and learn with Tsehay, count with John and laugh with Simon in Pull a Funny Face.

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: The Mechas need to act quickly when the snowman scarecrow that Zee made for MacBarm keeps blowing away!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo and Lila are excited to play on their new waterslide.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig arrives in a new electric car. The family all go for a ride and are surprised when the car talks and sings!

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Mojo is go-go in the snow with Tao as they snowboard together, if Mojo doesnt freeze up!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: Kwazii takes Tracker to the desert for his final test to become an Octo-Agent but they get lost while helping a young golden mole. To survive, they must do as the desert creatures do and find water.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: During a friendly game of neighbourhood cricket, the dads struggle to bowl Rusty out.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The dog and the squirrels decide to play hide and seek and Duggee finds them all except Roly.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: The Cobs try to capture Supertato while Evil Pea is on holiday, but it goes wrong resulting in Evil Pea getting covered in flour and custard over in the bath products aisle.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo and Bluey have five minutes to bed, just enough time to race to the summit of Mount Mumandad! But facing powerful storms, avalanches and stinky spots, this will take teamwork.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: The Tombliboos trousers get mixed up all over the place in the Ninky Nonk, in the Pinky Ponk.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: Its a rainy day, so the Sound Collector creates a magic carpet ride for Mole!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing wants to play his car park game with Flop but Charlie is visiting and keeps messing up the game. Bing doesnt enjoy his game on his own and finds out that some games are better played together.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Granny and Grandpas pet, Polly Parrot comes to stay. Peppa and George love her as shes very funny and repeats everything anyone says. When Polly flies away, no one can get her back, until George comes up with a plan.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer returns from the fair triumphant - hes won a coconut! He soon discovers getting into the coconut isnt as easy as it seems.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: A lovely day out at sea turns into a major ocean rescue when Mandy and Norman tussle over who should be captain!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly and Nanny Plum join Ben at Elf School, where the Wise Old Elf tells them that strictly no magic should be used. All the Elf children are very good at building their toys.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Today Peppa is making a quilt for the new addition to the family. Together with Mummy Pig and Granny Pig, they collect old fabric and create a beautiful quilt embellished with memories.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets train Bondi and Sandy for their annual Iron Roo carnival - but how far are they willing to go to win?

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: The Super Monsters show teamwork makes the impossible possible by growing a magical seed together.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stanley must keep Myrtles pumpkin safe from Speedy the snail.

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie makes hair washing fun by discovering some thinking tricks as part of the bath time routine.

programme.title: Play School Story Time
programme.desc: Will Lou make it to the loo in time? Bringing his humour and wit to the Story Time couch, Richard Roxburgh, alongside Play Schools Joey, perform an entertaining read of Busting! by Aaron Blabey.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Alphablock I really wants to win the big vowel race - this episode has fun with all the vowels and the words van, bus, hop, red, fog, mud, tap, bug, mop, hen, din, fin and win.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig arrives in a new electric car. The family all go for a ride and are surprised when the car talks and sings!

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the baby Pea-Rexes inadvertently start a massive roar off with all the other Vegesaurs.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: When a sudden allergy means Fergie cant pick apples, Vida sets up a "Fergie Tree!"

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Fred, Fifi and Ari call Stanley to help them with their recycling drive by coming up with a way of repurposing all the towns old stuff.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Greg feels scared on an overnight camping trip. He thinks his nighttime powers will help him but Orticia has something worrying in store.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets train Bondi and Sandy for their annual Iron Roo carnival - but how far are they willing to go to win?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: When Rebecca works with the Troublesome Trucks everyone expects the worst, but Rebecca defies expectations and has a very chucklesome day.

programme.title: Reef School
programme.desc: When Jaws the jawfish loses his special shell, the Reefies put on their detective caps to solve the mystery. Could a peculiar peacock shrimp hold the missing clue?

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles as they share their favourite things. Evie contacts the manager of her favourite band to arrange a special performance by The Carrot Sticks. Get ready for an unforgettable show!

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: Its Halloween and the Zee Mobile is pulling the hayride. The Mechas need to help when the Zee Mobile drives away!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: During a friendly game of neighbourhood cricket, the dads struggle to bowl Rusty out.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are re-enacting the Apollo Moon Landing with the help of Granny Pigs historical re-enactment society. Grampy Rabbit has lent them his rocket, but no one has told him its just pretend.

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Carrying a giant chicken to the country fair proves trickier than Mojo and Bo expected!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: The Octonauts try to answer a wetas call for help, but they cant find the right one! Turns out there are many different species of weta in New Zealand, so they have to do some detective work to find their target.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Dad is pretending to be an estate agent selling the Grannies house to Mum. But Janet and Rita dont want to move out!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are playing with their toys when they notice that there is a sheep in the clubhouse. Wait a minute! There are sheep everywhere! Inside and out! How did that happen?!

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato is delighted when Evil Pea comes to his birthday party, but Carrot is suspicious. Soon Evil Pea unleashes the Mini Peas, who try to steal Supertatos birthday present.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: A quick trip to the shops proves tricky for Dad, when Bingo and Bluey want to play a game of Kids. Now Bluey is Mum, Bingos her baby and Dad is a very naughty boy.

programme.desc: Sandro submits to a humiliating stress test, Caroline discovers how school students can manage their moods, and Shalin explores the science of comfort food.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.desc: Geelong will face Brisbane in the AFL Grand Final. Abbey Gelmi and the panel Laura Spurway, Waleed Aly and Ryan Hoffman discuss the AFL Preliminary Finals, the NRL Semis and Gout Gouts World Athletic Championships campaign.

programme.title: Landline: India
programme.desc: A looming future: Wool grown in Australia, sent to India to be processed and turned into products exported to the world.

programme.title: Tech Smart Agriculture
programme.desc: Fruit flies are one of Australias most destructive and costly pests. But a new high-tech trap using the same technology as the fingerprint ID on a smartphone, promises to reduce chemical use.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As the day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. Bridget Brennan and James Glenday present the latest news, overnight developments and top stories, joined by Catherine Murphy with sport and Nate Byrne with weather.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Kathryn Robinson brings you todays top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter most.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to cover whats happening and why it matters. Kathryn Robinson brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Johnson Raela presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Chas and John cover a monumental week in global affairs as world leaders descend on New York for the UN General Assembly, with Palestinian statehood and wars in Gaza and Ukraine high on the agenda.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: Know the latest on the days top stories, as Michael Tetlow brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong looks at the week in Asia: A ceasefire between Thailand and Cambodia under strain, the head of South Koreas unification church questioned plus Beijing and Manila trade barbs over another South China Sea incident.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As each day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. Bridget Brennan and James Glenday present the latest news, overnight developments and todays top stories, joined by Emma Rebellato, Catherine Murphy and Nate Byrne.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to tell you whats happening and why it matters. Ros Childs brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: Former members of the group once known as Exclusive Brethren talk about the psychological manipulation, surveillance and threats the church allegedly uses against them, as well as attempts to intimidate and buy their silence.
